text: A tautology is a statement that is always true by definition.
If it's raining, then it's raining.
Either it will rain tomorrow, or it will not rain tomorrow.
If all humans are mortal, and Socrates is a human, then Socrates is mortal.
A bachelor is an unmarried man.
If P is true, then P is true.
The sum of two even numbers is always even.
A square has four equal sides and four equal angles.
If A equals B, and B equals C, then A equals C.
A prime number is a natural number greater than one that is not divisible by any positive integer other than itself and one.
If all X are Y, and all Y are Z, then all X are Z.
A circle is a shape where all points are equidistant from the center.
If a number is divisible by both 2 and 3, then it is divisible by 6.
A palindrome reads the same forwards and backwards.
If a triangle has three equal sides, then it has three equal angles.
The way that can be spoken is not the eternal way.
A single conversation with a wise man is better than ten years of study.
The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
If you want to know the road ahead, ask those coming back.
The more you sweat in training, the less you bleed in combat.
A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials.
The best time to make friends is before you need them.
If you want happiness for an hour, take a nap. If you want happiness for a day, go fishing.
The man who asks a question is a fool for a minute, the man who does not ask is a fool for life.
A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step, and ends with a single step.
The more you give, the more you receive. The more you learn, the more you know.
If you want to be happy, be. If you want to be wise, learn. If you want to be strong, practice.
